qas.question: What explorer traveled through the Tuvalu islands in 1764?
What was Captain Byron doing when he visited Tuvalu?
How did Byron name the Tuvalu islands?
Which island of Tuvalu was identified as the one that Mourelle sailed past in 1781?
When were chronometers available for accurate location charting?

context: <a0_0>Captain John Byron<a0_0/> passed through the islands of Tuvalu in 1764 during his <a1_0>circumnavigation of the globe<a1_0/> as captain of the Dolphin (1751). Byron charted the atolls as <a2_0>Lagoon Islands<a2_0/>. Keith S. Chambers and Doug Munro (1980) identified <a3_0>Niutao<a3_0/> as the island that Francisco Mourelle de la Rúa sailed past on 5 May 1781, thus solving what Europeans had called The Mystery of Gran Cocal. Mourelle's map and journal named the island El Gran Cocal ('The Great Coconut Plantation'); however, the latitude and longitude was uncertain. Longitude could only be reckoned crudely as accurate chronometers were unavailable until the <a4_0>late 18th<a4_0/> century.
